channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump says he is revoking Biden's security clearances
item.description: Former presidents are historically given intelligence briefings after leaving office. But Trump said he was following precedent set by Biden four years ago, when Biden revoked Trump's access.
item.content:encoded:
Former presidents are historically given intelligence briefings after leaving office. But Trump said he was following precedent set by Biden four years ago, when Biden revoked Trump's access.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: What's Trump's beef with South Africa?
item.description: Trump has accused South Africa of "human rights violations" and a land grab. The South African government has hit back.
item.content:encoded:
Trump has accused South Africa of "human rights violations" and a land grab. The South African government has hit back.

(Image credit: Rodger Bosch)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Is there a Trump Doctrine for Foreign Policy?
item.description:
A lot of labels have been applied to Trump's foreign policy approach. America First, Isolationist, transactional, imperialist, protectionist. "I'm a nationalist and a globalist" he told the Wall Street Journal during his first term.

In his inaugural address last month, Trump made comments suggesting his foreign policy will be characterized by restraint, saying, in part, success should be defined by the "wars we never get into."

Yet in the same address, he also said, the United States will take back the Panama Canal.

In his first campaign, Trump ran on the idea that the cycle of the United States intervening in the Middle East should come to an end.

And on Tuesday of this week, he said that the U.S. will "take over" the Gaza Strip, after relocating the Palestinians, who live there.

Trump has promised a new approach to American foreign policy. Is there a Trump Doctrine? And what is it?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org
item.content:encoded:
A lot of labels have been applied to Trump's foreign policy approach. America First, Isolationist, transactional, imperialist, protectionist. "I'm a nationalist and a globalist" he told the Wall Street Journal during his first term.

In his inaugural address last month, Trump made comments suggesting his foreign policy will be characterized by restraint, saying, in part, success should be defined by the "wars we never get into."

Yet in the same address, he also said, the United States will take back the Panama Canal.

In his first campaign, Trump ran on the idea that the cycle of the United States intervening in the Middle East should come to an end.

And on Tuesday of this week, he said that the U.S. will "take over" the Gaza Strip, after relocating the Palestinians, who live there.

Trump has promised a new approach to American foreign policy. Is there a Trump Doctrine? And what is it?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

(Image credit: Kevin Lamarque/Pool)

item.title: Trump administration pauses $3 billion marked for electric vehicle charging stations
item.description: The Federal Highway Administration said the National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure (NEVI) program is under review. It was part of the Biden administration's clean energy push.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Highway Administration said the National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure (NEVI) program is under review. It was part of the Biden administration's clean energy push.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Judge pauses Trump order to put USAID employees on administrative leave
item.description: The case, brought by the American Foreign Service Association and the American Federation of Government Employees was intended to block the administration's efforts to dismantle USAID.
item.content:encoded:
The case, brought by the American Foreign Service Association and the American Federation of Government Employees was intended to block the administration's efforts to dismantle USAID.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: With the surge in sports betting, the risk of gambling addiction rises too
item.description: Mobile apps have put sportsbooks in the hands of millions, and experts are seeing a surge in betting — and higher risk of problem gambling. As the Super Bowl approaches, a recovering addict shares his story.
item.content:encoded:
Mobile apps have put sportsbooks in the hands of millions, and experts are seeing a surge in betting — and higher risk of problem gambling. As the Super Bowl approaches, a recovering addict shares his story.

(Image credit: Chantel Holt)
item.dc:creator: Windsor Johnston

item.title: Chris Jones crying before kickoff? Kansas City Chiefs fans say that's a good sign
item.description: During Chiefs games, defensive tackle Chris Jones is a six-foot-six, 310-pound wrecking ball. But he's become known for showing a softer side during performances of the national anthem.
item.content:encoded:
During Chiefs games, defensive tackle Chris Jones is a six-foot-six, 310-pound wrecking ball. But he's become known for showing a softer side during performances of the national anthem.

(Image credit: Brooke Sutton)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Who is part of Elon Musk's DOGE and what are they doing?
item.description: The scope of DOGE's work and the identities of the people carrying it out isn't fully clear — leaving agencies and government workers in chaos.
item.content:encoded:
The scope of DOGE's work and the identities of the people carrying it out isn't fully clear — leaving agencies and government workers in chaos.

(Image credit: Pool)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Trump says Japan's Nippon Steel will now invest in U.S. Steel -- not take it over
item.description: The president said Nippon Steel would invest in U.S. Steel rather than take over the storied American manufacturer. He also said DOGE would look for savings at the Pentagon and Education Department.
item.content:encoded:
The president said Nippon Steel would invest in U.S. Steel rather than take over the storied American manufacturer. He also said DOGE would look for savings at the Pentagon and Education Department.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Rape crisis centers see funding delays amid Trump administration spending upheaval
item.description: Groups addressing sexual violence report not getting expected payments from grants that they depend on to keep running.
item.content:encoded:
Groups addressing sexual violence report not getting expected payments from grants that they depend on to keep running.

(Image credit: Michael Siluk/Universal Images Group)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone
